data.title: The Rite of Napoleon. Detail depicting Marie

data.meta_description: Prints of JLJ4646641 The Rite of Napoleon. Detail depicting Marie-Julie Clary (wife of Joseph Bonaparte)
data.text:
Fine Art Finder Photo Prints and Wall Art

The Rite of Napoleon. Detail depicting Marie-Julie Clary (wife of Joseph Bonaparte

JLJ4646641 The Rite of Napoleon. Detail depicting Marie-Julie Clary (wife of Joseph Bonaparte, 1771-1845); General Jean Andoche Junot (Jean-Andoche) (1771-1813) (governor of Paris colonel general of the hussars), a vicar, Auguste-Laurent, count dit Monsieur de Remusat (prefet of the palace, 1762-1823) and two chamberlords during the Sacred Emperor Napoleon I Bonaparte and Coronation by Imperatrice Josephine to Notre-Dame de Paris on December 2, 1804. Painting by Jacques Louis David (1748-1825), 1804-1806. Oil on canvas. Dim: 6, 210x9, 790m. - The Coronation of Napoleon (or The Consecration of Napoleon). Detail representing Marie-Julie Clary (wife of Joseph Bonaparte, 1771-1845); the General Jean Andoche Junot (Jean- Andoche) (1771-1813) (Governor General of Paris and Colonel of the hussards), a Vicar, Auguste-Laurent, Comte called Monsieur de Remusat (Prefect of the Palace, 1762-1823) and two Chamberlains Consecration of the Emperor Napoleon I Bonaparte and Coronation of the Empress Josephine in Notre-Dame de Paris on 2 December 1804. Painting by Jacques Louis David (1748-1825), 1804-1806. Oil on canvas. 6, 210 x 9, 790m. Louvre museum, Paris by David, Jacques Louis (1748-1825); Louvre, Paris, France; (add.info.: The Rite of Napoleon. Detail depicting Marie-Julie Clary (wife of Joseph Bonaparte, 1771-1845); General Jean Andoche Junot (Jean-Andoche) (1771-1813) (governor of Paris colonel general of the hussars), a vicar, Auguste-Laurent, count dit Monsieur de Remusat (prefet of the palace, 1762-1823) and two chamberlords during the Sacred Emperor Napoleon I Bonaparte and Coronation by Imperatrice Josephine to Notre-Dame de Paris on December 2, 1804. Painting by Jacques Louis David (1748-1825), 1804-1806. Oil on canvas. Dim: 6, 210x9, 790m. - The Coronation of Napoleon (or The Consecration of Napoleon). Detail representing Marie-Julie Clary (wife of Joseph Bonaparte, 1771-1845); the General Jean Andoche Junot (Jean- Andoche) (1771-1813) (Governor General of Paris and Colonel of the hussards), a Vicar, Auguste-Laurent, Comte called Monsieur de Remusat (Prefect of the Palace, 1762-1823) and two Chamberlains Consecration of the Emperor Napoleon I Bonaparte and Coronation of the Empress Josephine in Notre-Dame de Paris on 2 December 1804. Painting by Jacques Louis David (1748-1825), 1804-1806. Oil on canvas. 6, 210 x 9, 790m. Louvre museum, Paris); Photo ePhoto Josse; French, out of copyright. Â© Josse / Bridgeman Images
